info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 1:38PM MDT until March 18 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... South central Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico...
* Until 430 PM MDT.
* At 136 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Luna, Central Hidalgo and South Central Grant counties.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 55 mph.
SOURCE...Law enforcement.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Interstate 10 is closed between Lordsburg and Las Cruces. Motorists should pull off to designated parking areas in Lordsburg, Deming and Las Cruces.
* This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 109.
Locations impacted include... Spring Canyon State Park, Animas, Cotton City, Sunshine, Pyramid Mountains, Akela, Hermanas, Windmill, Rock Hound State Park, Camp Ramsey, Steins, Big Hatchet Refuge, Hachita Valley, Playas, Shakespeare, Carzalia Valley, Lordsburg, Granite Gap, Road Forks, and Separ.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 4:30 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 4:30 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Grant, NM; Hidalgo, NM; Luna, NM

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:30 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:30 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Grant, NM; Hidalgo, NM; Luna, NM
